chunks.original_text: 孳孳为利贪虚矫。 性命俱忘，财色心奸狡。 恶业无涯阴德少，将来事、一场不小。 无常限满酆都召。 鬼使挐挐瞋，不悟我金鸡叫。 又 日日朝朝常报晓，徒人省、搜玄搜妙。 孳孳为善回光照。 勘破浮生，便把家缘掉。 九曲明珠安九窍，丝连蚁、火光频燎。 往来穿透功夫了。 得赴蓬瀛，出自我金鸡叫。 又 火院中间常火燎，忧儿女、形容衰了。 傍人替你生烦恼。 投献诗词，万望心明晓。 不测无常非事小，悟来后、便搜玄妙。 蓬莱云路通关要。 炼就金丹，出自我金鸡叫。 又 外骋惺惺非是俏，内修持、些儿最妙。 真如一点三光照。 爇起心香，自有祥烟罩。 李四高人如悟晓，无中有、非常冥杳。 胎仙舞袖麾灵耀。 跨鹤腾空，出自我金鸡叫。 又 元是神仙何不晓，听予劝、家缘事小。 迷津苦海须当跳。 一个灵明，兔使尘笼罩。 物外澄心通密妙，常清净、龙蟠虎远。 神丹结正腾辉耀。 返老还童，出自我金鸡叫。 又 日暮残辉何不晓，好收心、回光返照。 宜乎急急搜玄妙。 疾速修持，莫待西沉了。 物外修仙非是矫，早认取、言钩语钓。 诗词香饵吞些小。 跃出迷津，悟得我金鸡叫。 又 入道已蒙相许了，火坑深、宜乎猛跳。 男儿出语无虚矫。 慎勿迟疑，休使傍人笑。 断制家缘回日早，休似鹤、留言华表。 从斯马钰登高眺。 奉劝吾兄，莫忘我金鸡叫。 又 三髻山侗闲失笑，离乡井、无愁买恼。 忧他性命无心了。 终日哀人，忘了自家道。 堪可垂钩须索钓，且不免、厮煎打炒。 耐羞耐耻频频告。 谨劝贤家，早悟我金鸡叫。 又 许我年时来入道，想贤家、心无虚矫。 劝公早早家缘掉。 稍稍迟迟，做出诸宫调。 若肯回头何事好，乐情闲、持杯欢笑。 抚琴月下沉香袅。 搜获玄机，别有个金鸡叫。 神清秀#2 寄看庞总管园赵公 些儿微妙非常好。 猛焰裹、自然芝草。 玉虎与金龙，密护三田宝。 丹成九转青童报。 便授取、紫微宣诰。 体挂六铢衣，跨鹤归蓬岛。 道成归#3二首 阮郎归改道成归，修行人喜知。 松峰影裹乐希夷，何须唱艳词。 姹婴动，虎龙随，云耕坎与离。 三千功满赴瑶池，神光相貌奇。 赠岳秀才藏头 □年苦志不求奇，□公寻者希。 □夷猛悟笑微微，□华枉用机。 □子偃，□婴肥，□宫祥瑞围。 □传心印谨相依，□灵神自飞。 迎仙客 日中乌，月中兔，走飞子午何曾住。 虎随龙，龙随虎，东西来往，自是明琼路。 姹娘歌，婴子舞，玉堂裹面金为主。 云为朋，霞为侣，逍遥自在，开阐全真户。 系云腰（系裙腰） 昆嵛山上丹阳子，真得得，遇风仙。 今生相应前生约，访秦川，居地肺，结良缘。 离清坎静水生火，婴姹睡，虎龙眠。 神凝气聚灵光现，驾云轩，透祥烟，去朝元。 登仙门二首 师也师也，重阳师也。 处玄机，静中清也。 起金莲玉花社，有谁知也。 化人人，渐归道也。 这扶风，非开悟，亦非愚也。 辨假真，稍能明也。 细寻思，心豁畅，略无疑也。 想师范，没人过也。 又 难也难也，舍家难也。
chunks.translated_text:
Relentless in greed, deceitful and false,
Nature and life both forgotten—
Wealth and lust breed cunning.
Evil karma boundless, hidden virtue scant,
What awaits is no small matter.

When the appointed hour arrives, Fengdu summons,
Ghostly messengers seize you in wrath—
Yet still you heed not my golden rooster’s crow.

**Again**

Day after day, ever heralding dawn,
Yet men remain heedless, searching for mystery.
Diligently cultivate goodness, turn the light inward.
See through this fleeting life,
Then cast aside worldly ties.

The nine-curved bright pearl fits its nine apertures,
Threaded like ants drawn to flame—
Pierce through, and the work is done.
Bound for Penglai’s isles,
All arises from my golden rooster’s crow.

**Again**

Within the fiery household, flames ever burn,
Anxious for children, your visage withers.
Others fret for you in vain.
I offer poems and verses,
Hoping your heart awakens.

The unforeseen impermanence is no small thing—
Awaken, then seek the mystery.
The clouded path to Penglai holds the crucial pass.
Refine the golden elixir,
All arises from my golden rooster’s crow.

**Again**

Outward cleverness is no true grace,
Inward cultivation—even a little—is most wondrous.
True Suchness, a single gleam of the Three Lights.
Kindle the incense of the heart,
Auspicious mist will gather.

If the wise man Li Si awakens,
From nothingness arises something—
Profound and boundless.
The fetal immortal dances, sleeves swaying with radiant light.
Mounting the crane, soaring into the void,
All arises from my golden rooster’s crow.

**Again**

You are by nature an immortal—why not awaken?
Heed my counsel: worldly ties are small.
Leap from the bitter sea of delusion.
A single spark of spirit,
Yet trapped by dust’s snare.

Beyond the world, still the heart to fathom the mystery,
Ever pure—
Dragon coiled, tiger withdrawn.
The divine elixir congeals, radiance ascends.
Reverse aging, restore youth,
All arises from my golden rooster’s cry.

**Again**

As dusk’s fading light dims, why not awaken?
Gather your heart, turn the light inward.
Swiftly seek the mystery,
Hasten in cultivation—
Lest the sun sink beyond reach.

Cultivating immortality beyond the world is no pretense,
Recognize early the hook in words, the bait in speech.
Swallow a little of the poetic lure,
Leap from the sea of delusion,
And grasp my golden rooster’s cry.

**Again**

Having been granted entry to the Dao,
The fire pit runs deep—best leap boldly.
A man’s word should hold no falsehood.
Take care not to hesitate,
Lest others mock you.

Sever worldly ties, return swiftly,
Unlike the crane leaving words on the stele.
From here, Ma Yu ascends to gaze afar.
I urge you, my brother,
Never forget my golden rooster’s cry.

**Again**

The mountain rustic of Sanji laughs heedlessly,
Leaving home and hearth, needlessly courting sorrow.
Anxious for others’ lives, he forgets his own path.
All day lamenting for others,
Yet neglecting his own Dao.

One might cast a hook and seek the catch,
But first, endure the trials of fire and strife.
Bear shame, endure disgrace, and warn again and again.
I urge you, good sir,
Awaken early to my golden rooster’s cry.

**Again**

When I was permitted to enter the Dao,
I thought you, sir, held no deceit.
I urged you to cast aside worldly ties early.
A slight delay,
And you compose melodies of the many palaces.

If you but turn your head, how fine it would be—
Joyful and carefree, holding a cup in laughter.
Beneath the moon, plucking the lute, incense curls.
Searching for the mystery,
You’ll find another golden rooster’s cry.

---

**Subtle Wonders #2**
*For Steward Pang and Magistrate Zhao*

A trifling wonder, most extraordinary—
Within the raging flames,
Mushrooms of immortality grow naturally.
Jade tiger and golden dragon
Guard the Three Fields’ treasure in secret.

The elixir refined through nine cycles, the Azure Lad reports,
Then receives the Purple Tenuity’s decree.
Clad in the six-zhu robe,
Mounting the crane, he returns to Penglai’s isle.

---

**Dao Attained, Returning #3** *(Two Poems, to the tune of "Ruan Lang Gui")*

*Dao Attained, Returning*
The cultivator rejoices in knowing.
Within the pine peak’s shadow, delighting in stillness,
Why sing wanton verses?

The maiden stirs, tiger and dragon follow,
Plowing clouds through Kan and Li.
Three thousand merits fulfilled, bound for Jasper Pool,
His divine radiance and form wondrous.

---

**For Scholar Yue (Hidden Head Poem)**

□ Years of bitter resolve, seeking no marvel,
□ Few find the seeker.
□ Swift awakening, a faint smile,
□ Splendor vainly schemed.

□ The master reclines,
□ The maiden flourishes,
□ Auspicious clouds encircle the palace.
□ The mind-seal transmitted, faithfully upheld,
□ The spirit soars freely.

---

**Welcoming the Immortal**

Sun’s crow, moon’s hare,
Racing through Zi and Wu—never resting.
Tiger follows dragon, dragon follows tiger,
East and west they traverse,
Ever the luminous path of jade.

The maiden sings, the infant dances,
Within the jade hall, gold presides.
Clouds as companions, rosy hues as lovers,
Carefree and at ease,
Opening the gate of Perfect Truth.

---

**Cloud-Girdled Waist (Girdled Skirt’s Waist)**

On Kunyu’s peak, Master Danyang,
Truly blessed, met the Wind Immortal.
This life fulfills a past vow,
Visiting Qin’s riverlands, dwelling at Earth’s heart,
Forge a bond most true.

Li pure, Kan still—water births fire,
Infant and maiden slumber,
Tiger and dragon sleep.
Spirit congealed, qi gathered, divine light appears,
Mounting the cloud chariot,
Piercing the auspicious mist,
To ascend and pay homage to the Origin.

---

**Ascending the Gate of Immortality** *(Two Poems)*

Master, ah Master,
Master Chongyang!
Abiding in the mystery,
In stillness, pure.

Raising the golden lotus, the jade flower community—
Who knows this?
Transforming all,
Gradually returning to the Dao.

This Fengxiang—
Not enlightenment, nor folly.
Discerning false from true,
Slightly enlightened.

Ponder deeply,
Heart opened, doubts dispelled.
Recalling the master’s example—
None surpass him.

**Again**

Hard, ah hard!
Leaving home is hard!

chunks.original_text: 绝爱憎，屏尘难也。 处无为清静有，始终难也。 譬如死，又何难也。 论玄元，谈微妙，要人听也。 但小童，肯来询也。 便须当，开言路，与其进也。 我不能，保其往也。 渐悟集卷下竟 #1此词牌应为『捣练子』。 #2此词牌应为『海棠春』。 #3此词牌应为『阮郎归』。
chunks.translated_text:
Sever love and hate—
hard to cast off the dust.

Abiding in non-action, in purity and stillness—
hard from start to end.

Like death itself—
what could be harder?

Discoursing on the Mysterious Origin,
expounding subtleties—
all to be heard by others.

Yet if a young novice
comes forth to inquire,
then one must open the path of words,
guide them forward.

I cannot
ensure their journey ahead.

*Gradual Awakening Collection, Scroll the Lower, Concludes*

*(Tune: "Pounding Silk")*
*(Tune: "Spring of the Crabapple")*
*(Tune: "The Return of Ruan Lang")*
